messages.content: Be concise. Can lemons be used as deodorant?

No, lemons should not be used as deodorant. Lemons are acidic and can cause irritation and burns on the skin. Additionally, lemons do not have any antiperspirant properties and will not effectively prevent body odor. It's best to use a specially formulated deodorant to keep you smelling fresh and clean.
What is the pH of lemon juice?

The pH of lemon juice is typically around 2.0 to 2.5. Lemon juice is acidic, with a low pH, which makes it a good cleaning agent and a natural disinfectant. However, it is also important to note that the pH of lemon juice can vary depending on the variety of lemon and the specific conditions of its production and storage.
What about as a fridge deodorant?

Lemons can be used as a fridge deodorant in a pinch, but it is not the most effective solution. While the acid in lemons can help to remove odors, it is also likely to cause damage to the materials in your fridge and can leave a residue on your food. Instead, consider using a specially formulated fridge deodorant or a solution of baking soda and water to keep your fridge smelling fresh.
